    Continuous linear equivalences #

    Continuous semilinear / linear / star-linear equivalences between topological modules are denoted by M ‚âÉSL[œÉ] M‚ÇÇ, M ‚âÉL[R] M‚ÇÇ and M ‚âÉL‚ãÜ[R] M‚ÇÇ.

                                                                                                theorem Submodule.ClosedComplemented.exists_submodule_equiv_prod {R : Type u_1} [Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [TopologicalSpace M] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M] [IsTopologicalAddGroup M] {p : Submodule R M} (hp : p.ClosedComplemented) :
                                                                                                ‚àÉ (q : Submodule R M) (e : M ‚âÉL[R] ‚Ü•p √ó ‚Ü•q), (‚àÄ (x : ‚Ü•p), e ‚Üëx = (x, 0)) ‚àß (‚àÄ (y : ‚Ü•q), e ‚Üëy = (0, y)) ‚àß ‚àÄ (x : ‚Ü•p √ó ‚Ü•q), e.symm x = ‚Üëx.1 + ‚Üëx.2

                                                                                                If p is a closed complemented submodule, then there exists a submodule q and a continuous linear equivalence M ‚âÉL[R] (p √ó q) such that e (x : p) = (x, 0), e (y : q) = (0, y), and e.symm x = x.1 + x.2.

                                                                                                In fact, the properties of e imply the properties of e.symm and vice versa, but we provide both for convenience.
